result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Alton Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived DV surcharge due to inability to pay. Any bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violent contact with victim Karen W. 
No contact with firearms.

AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.
-----Court ordered Extended Supervision to be supervised in the Mental Health Unit.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Alton Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: PLEA/SENTENCINGTranscript commencing FEBRUARY 3, 2016 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF4248 (46 Pages).
Letter to defendant.  Filed in 15CF001195.
Letter from defendant regarding sentence credit and release date.  Received and filed in 15CF001195.
Recalled.
Bail Refund Packets
Per Clerical error:  " Court ordered Extended Supervision to be supervised in the Mental Health Unit" showing as ordered.
CLARIFICATION to sentencing entry dated 2/3/2016 to reflect correct no violent contact information.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 181 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Mental health evaluation.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim Karen W.
-Maintain employment/training for employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED DV surcharge due to inability to pay.
-Any bail on deposit is to be returned to the remitter.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

**Court ordered Extended Supervision to be supervised in the mental health unit**

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. Court VACATES Jury Trial.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case likely to resolve. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case remains scheduled for Jury Trial on 2/15/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court via telephone, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Benjamin T. Lindstrom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Due to parties being in trial, case adjourned to branch 24 for a Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Statements made by Karen W.  Court denied the request to modify the no contact order.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings. The NGI plea is not supported by the doctor.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for Doctor's Report Return.  Due to court calendar congestion, matter cannot be heard.  Case is adjourned to Branch Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for return of doctor's report.  Counsel would like a short adjournment so he can review the report with the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer for Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for return on doctor's report.  A report has not been completed yet.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Defendant has entered a NGI plea in 15CF4248.  Court ordered the 10/19/15 jury trial vacated.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Statements made by Karen W.  Court denied the request to modify the no contact order.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant has a new case which is set for preliminary hearing on 9/30/15.  Court ordered this matter adjourned.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
15RM041922  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 09/12/2015

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams NOT in court, in custody, in court attorney Calvin R. Malone. Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 40. State revoked the offer in this matter.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requested an additional date for a Status Conference.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for adjourned Scheduling Conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CM1604 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Ngeung Yang.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Without objection of defense, the court GRANTED state's motion to amend location address to 5571 from 5517, and the spelling of the charge from Batter to Battery.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Report states defendant was found to be competent to proceed. Defense and state do not contest findings. Court finding defendant is competent to proceed, reinstated proceedings. Court reinstated defendant's bail. Case set for Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Kenneth Alton Williams not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Defense counsel requests an adjournment to allow time to review report with the defendant. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Sarra Kiaie for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Karen W.  (Defendant unable to sign)

Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Kenneth Alton Williams in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case heard in the Milwaukee County Jail.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.   Defense moves to dismiss Count 2 as duplicitous.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
